instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A cpu warm, no fan spin
threads.message:
Hi, I have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A which covered in flux, all the <SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5</SIGNAL> caps is shorted, and when I  remove f7040, the ppbus is still shorted
magsafe is green then orange light when plugged in, cpu does get warm, but no fan spin

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A cpu warm, no fan spin
threads.message: Which big coil has exact the same ohm value to ground as <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A cpu warm, no fan spin
threads.message: Sounds like some moron killed the CPU by being stupid. This I would advise not wasting time on

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A cpu warm, no fan spin
threads.message: it takes little time to confirm a dead CPU.  Do some quick resistance checks on VCORE and PCH power supplies.  I have fixed many boards that have been covered in flux by monkeys.
